intro: Gueldenstaedtia delavayi f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered gueldenstaedtia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. It is native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
